subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4.10 Documentation?
msgSnippet: Mark, Not that I know of. Sorry. Corey ... [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
Mark,

Not that I know of. Sorry.

Corey


On Wed, Dec 19, 2012 at 9:54 AM, Mark Levison <mark@...> wrote:

> **
>
>
> Corey - thanks that's a great start. Is there any chance that the wiki
> is tagged for v4.10 and I could look at the examples in that context?
>
> Cheers
> Mark
>
>
> Corey Vaillancourt wrote:
> >
> > Mark,
> >
> > If you're looking for 4.10 Javadoc you can find it here:
> >
> > http://kentbeck.github.com/junit/javadoc/4.10/
> >
> > This includes Hamcrest Javadoc as well.
> >
> > I hope this helps!
> >
> > Corey
> >
> > On Dec 18, 2012, at 16:12, Mark Levison <mark@...
> > <mailto:mark%40mlevison.com>> wrote:
> >
> > I'm newly back in the land of Eclipse for a few weeks and I'm trying
> > to get
> > my head wrapped around the minutia of JUnit 4.10 and Hamcrest.Core
> > 1.1.0 as
> > these are what come with Eclipse Juno. Where it up to me I would just
> > upgrade to the most current JUnit and Hamcrest but its probably best I
> > stick close to the client's devenv.
> >
> > Is there an elegant way to see the old documentation? Perhaps some git
> > magic of displaying all wiki pages labelled 4.10?
> > In addition is there some way to find the list of supported Hamcrest
> > matchers? I spent an hour this afternoon trying to get greaterThan() to
> > work. Either I don't know the right package or its not included in
> > Hamcrest.core.
> >
> > Thanks
> > Mark Levison - human part time
